channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How does a Fortune 500 company rebuild its supply chain overnight? Most are piecing together a playbook on the fly
item.description: “Almost every client I talk to has a war room,” says Mary Rollman, KPMG’s U.S. supply-chain leader.

item.title: ‘I Hope I Am Wrong, but I Am Pretty Pessimistic’: Four Economists Dissect Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: The most dramatic effort to remake the post-World War II trade system was underway — until it wasn’t.

item.title: Katy Perry is ‘psychologically’ preparing for her Blue Origin spaceflight with Lauren Sanchez by repeating affirmations and studying string theory
item.description: On Monday, she will join Jeff Bezos’ fiancee Lauren Sanchez, journalist Gayle King and three other women on an all-female Blue Origin spaceflight.

item.title: As JPMorgan, Wells Fargo and Morgan Stanley beat expectations, Jamie Dimon says he cares most that the ‘Western world stays together economically’
item.description: Mostly positive bank earnings were clouded by the chaotic start to Q2 and the murky economic outlook.

item.title: The U.S. dollar is losing its status as a safe haven thanks to Trump’s tariffs. What does that mean for investors?
item.description: The dollar is taking a beating as Trump's tariff policies cause widespread uncertainty, threatening its status as the world's reserve currency.

item.title: Ex-Abercrombie CEO charged with sex trafficking crimes is suffering from dementia and can’t stand trial, prosecutors and defense say
item.description: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Michael Jeffries is suffering from dementia and isn't competent to stand trial on sex trafficking charges.

item.title: Miami-Dade Mayor Vetoes Plan to Remove Fluoride From Drinking Water
item.description: The veto by Mayor Daniella Levine Cava, a Democrat, pushed back on a growing campaign against the mineral, which has been used for decades to prevent ...

item.title: Tesla U.S. Sales Plunge as G.M. and Others Make Gains
item.description: Overall sales of electric vehicles rose almost 11 percent in the first three months of the year as traditional carmakers offered new models.

item.title: JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon Warns of ‘Considerable Turbulence’ Ahead for Economy
item.description: JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon, known for his frankness, is tiptoeing around tariffs as he and other leaders of big banks reveal their latest earnings.

item.title: Hegseth Attends Ukraine Defense Group Only Virtually
item.description: Pete Hegseth’s predecessor as defense secretary, Lloyd J. Austin III, started the roughly 50-nation group to support Kyiv after Russia invaded in 2022...

item.title: Con Artists Scamming London Tourists Meet Their Match: Batman and Robin
item.description: The police shared video of an unconventional tactic that led to two arrests in London: Going undercover as superheroes.

item.title: Steeling China for a Tariff Fight, Xi Faces His Biggest Test Since Covid
item.description: Xi Jinping has refused to back down in China’s tariff confrontation with President Trump. But he’ll have to persuade his people that the pain is worth...

item.title: Trump Will End Temporary Protections for Afghans and Cameroonians
item.description: More than 10,000 people will be put on track for deportation in May and June as a result of the Department of Homeland Security’s action.

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. Bond Yields Spike as Tariff Turmoil Spooks Investors
item.description: The increase in yields on U.S. government bonds was a sign that the world’s faith in the United States economy had been shaken. At the same time, the ...

item.title: Fiery Boca Raton Plane Crash Leaves 3 Dead
item.description: A man in a car also was injured when the small plane crashed near an interstate overpass a short distance from Boca Raton Airport in Florida, the auth...
